description.narrative: This project mainly contributes to results within Economic empowerment of women. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020

VILUTHU is a core funding to promote a culture of democracy, strengthening participatory mechanisms and structures of governance through a strategy of supporting human capacity building in state and non-state institutions. Creating a society of equals participatory and accountable socio political values The lack of Economical Social Political and Cultural Rights for rights holders in the North and East from resulting civil war has contributed to forming state, societal structures and processes that lack justice, accountability, transparency and inclusive process for constitutional reform with weak participatory democracy mechanisms in place. This main problem causes different socio-political economic faced in Sri Lanka, negligence in addressing root causes of the conflict have complicated the ongoing reconciliation process. Objectives; to create a society with democratic values and practices, with participatory and accountable socio-political structures; to empower women headed households by strengthening their capacities, raising awareness in all socio cultural, political and economic spheres; and strengthening grassroots communities to advocate and contribute to transitional justice mechanisms. Main activities; Providing advocacy training and exposure to women headed households for action for change; strengthening, widening the networks focussing on relevant key constitutional, rights based issues and mobilising for movements take local initiatives; Initiate a community memorialisation process, serve to honour the victims and their families; Address contemporary issues and contribute to a national policy and memorialisation Expected outcome; Capacitated women voicing concerns, demanding for equitable policies and law, not only raise living standards of women but contribute to form policies and legislation and empowered women and girls in different levels. Increased standard of organic products and established a National Social Enterprise model to suits their needs.
